intro: Agathosma hortensis var. spontanea, commonly known as wild Cape chamomile, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with aromatic, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its essential oils, rich in sesquiterpene lactones, are used in traditional medicine and aromatherapy. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
